critique: This document concerns the revocation of an executive order withdrawing public lands in New Mexico and the subsequent opening of these lands for homesteading, particularly favoring ex-service men. It does not directly address ideological issues, immigration, executive power in a broad sense, or national security. It touches on federalism by dealing with public lands, which are often a matter of federal control, and economic regulation by opening land for homesteading. It also has a slight social inclusion aspect by prioritizing ex-service men.
